dt: {bc}a corresponding joint in the anterior limb of a lower vertebrate
{bc}something (such as macaroni or an angular pipe fitting) resembling an elbow

et: Middle English {it}elbowe{/it}, from Old English {it}elboga{/it}, from {it}el-{/it} (akin to {it}eln{/it} ell) + Old English {it}boga{/it} bow {ma}{mat|ell|}, {mat|bow|}{/ma}
shortdef: the joint of the human arm
a corresponding joint in the anterior limb of a lower vertebrate
something (such as macaroni or an angular pipe fitting) resembling an elbow

dt: {bc}to shove aside by pushing with or as if with the elbow

dt.t: people {wi}elbowed{/wi} each other to get a better view

dt: {bc}to force (one's way) by pushing with or as if with the elbow
{bc}to advance by pushing with the elbow

shortdef: to push with the elbow : jostle
to shove aside by pushing with or as if with the elbow
to force (one's way) by pushing with or as if with the elbow

dt: {bc}a gesture in which two people bump their elbows together especially as an alternative to a {d_link|handshake|handshake}

dt.t: It was before the public was told to wear masks, before the {wi}elbow bump{/wi} became the new handshake, before all of the symptoms were known.
Vice President Mike Pence and his wife, Karen, also attended the ceremony in New York, and he chatted with Mr. Biden, trading an {wi}elbow bump{/wi} in lieu of a handshake, a nod to the pandemic.

shortdef: a gesture in which two people bump their elbows together especially as an alternative to a handshake

dt.t: There is just no substitution for the {wi}elbow grease{/wi} involved in promotion. You just have to get out there and work hard to get the word to the stores that the book is available.
Best of all, the metal handle is bendable, making it easy to defat liquids of varying depths. Kudos to a kitchen tool that spares {wi}elbow grease{/wi}.

shortdef: hard work; especially : vigorously applied physical labor or effort

dt.t: a lab with plenty of {it}elbow room{/it}

shortdef: room for moving the elbows freely
adequate space for work or operation

dt: {bc}inflammation and pain over the outer side of the elbow usually resulting from excessive strain on and twisting of the forearm

shortdef: inflammation and pain over the outer side of the elbow usually resulting from excessive strain on and twisting of the forearm

dt.t: His assistant is always {it}at his elbow{/it}.
The drink {it}at her elbow{/it} was untouched.
She {it}gave{/it} her boyfriend {it}the elbow{/it} after he lied to her.

shortdef: to tell someone to go away

dt: used to say that one approves of what someone is doing and hopes it will be successful

dt.t: If he wants to write a book, {it}more power to his elbow{/it}!

shortdef: —used to say that one approves of what someone is doing and hopes it will be successful

meta.id: not know one's arse from one's elbow
stems: not know her arse from her elbow
not know his arse from his elbow
not know one's arse from one's elbow
not know their arse from their elbow

hwi.hw: not know one's arse from one's elbow

dt.t: Don't take his word for it—he {it}doesn't know his arse from his elbow{/it}.

shortdef: to know nothing : to be stupid
